title: What is AI?
explanation: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is the simulation of human intelligence processes by machines, especially computer systems. These processes include learning, reasoning, and self-correction.
analogy: Think of AI like a very smart puppy. You have to train it (machine learning) for it to know what to do. It doesn't just 'know' things magically; it learns from examples you show it.
key_takeaway: AI is not magic. It's math and code that learns patterns from data.

title: Machine Learning vs. Traditional Code
explanation: In traditional programming, you give the computer rules and data to get answers. In Machine Learning, you give the computer data and answers, and it learns the rules.
analogy: Traditional programming is like following a recipe exactly. Machine Learning is like tasting a dish and figuring out the recipe yourself by guessing and checking.
key_takeaway: ML figures out the rules (logic) on its own by looking at data.

title: Large Language Models (LLMs)
explanation: LLMs are deep learning models trained on massive datasets to understand and generate human language. They predict the next word in a sequence based on probability.
analogy: Imagine a super-read librarian who has read every book in the world but has amnesia. If you ask them a question, they guess the most likely next word based on everything they've ever read, one word at a time.
key_takeaway: LLMs are next-token predictors, not 'thinking' beings.
